docs.title: geronimo
docs.text: geronimo is a minimal and easy-to-learn Python library for your quick and dirty everday math calculations, especially regarding high-dimensional geometry calculations.

docs.title: Get started
docs.text: Read the instructions on how to install geronimo, or start right off by reading the documentation of the library's classes.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
from geronimo.geometry.point import Point
from geronimo.geometry.vector import Vector

# define points in three-dimensional space:
p0 = Point([0, 0, 0])   # (works with higher dimensions too!)
p1 = Point([8, 4, 2])

# create a vector from the points:
v0 = Vector.from_points(p0, p1)

# get the length of a vector:
print(v0.length())  # ≈ 9.165

# use pure Python math syntax for operations:
v1, v2 = v0 * 0.25, v0.normalize()

print(v1.length(), v2.length()) # ≈ 2.291, 1.0

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: This page will teach you about the ways to install the geronimo library in your project or environment.

docs.title: pip
docs.text:
To install geronimo, you can simply use pip on any newer Python version (>= 3.10):

pip install geronimo

docs.title: Manual
docs.text:
You may also clone the repo manually and use it in an interactive shell if you just want to mess around with it.

git clone https://github.com/mags0ft/geronimo.git
cd geronimo
python3 -i -c "import geronimo"
